results.title: Bridging the highways
results.creator_credit: Dorman Long & Co and John Byrd
results.brief_description: Steel bridges put together on site from prefabricated universal sections mean a saving in labour and greater speed in bridge constructions. The sections are despatched ready for erection to numerous sites all over modern motorway Britain.
results.description: Steel bridges put together on site from prefabricated universal sections mean a saving in labour and greater speed in bridge constructions. The sections are despatched ready for erection to numerous sites all over modern motorway Britain.

results.title: Bridging the gap: the many worlds of Mandawuy (A)
results.creator_credit: John Walsh, Kevin Ryder and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
Paolo Totaro hosts a discussion between Rhoda Roberts (Vox Populi), Sonia Voumard (The Age) and Mandawauy Yunupingu (teacher, musican, ambassador and father), on the eve of National Aborigines Day. Mandawuy explores the ways he is bridging the gap between black and white culture through both his band Yothu Yindi, the first aboriginal band to make the charts and to sign with an American record company; and as the Principal of the Yirrkala Community School in North East Arnhem Land, where, as the first aboriginal headmaster, he devised the curriculum mix of aboriginal and western studies known as “Both Ways Education”.

results.title: Bridging the gap
results.brief_description: Designed to help acquire and realise the vital skills of parent-child communications. Dr Thomas Gordon, a nationally recognised authority, discusses such needs as identity, honest recognition of feelings, and courageous action as new methods of communicating, in an attempt to establish a deeper, and more intimate, relationship between parent and child.

results.title: Bridging the centuries
results.creator_credit: Royal Doulton, World Wide and John Patterson Reid
results.brief_description: Traces the history of pottery making in Britain from neolithic times to the present day. Examples of rare English pottery and china from different centuries are shown. Illustrates the influence of Chinese work on the development of English bone china. Describes the evolution of English translucent china particularly for tableware.

results.title: Bridget Riley
results.creator_credit: Balfour Films, Arts Council of Great Britain and David Thompson
results.brief_description: A profile of artist, Bridget Riley. Explores the inspirations she draws from the visual experiences in nature and follows her into her studio where she organises and activates her paintings. Credits include A.A. Englander (photographer) and Roy Ayton (editor).

results.title: Bridget Jones's diary [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Little Bird Ltd, Studio Canal, Working Title Films, Debra Hayward, Liza Chasin and Sharon Maguire
results.brief_description: Bridget Jones (Renee Zellweger) is 32, single, smokes too much, drinks too much, and says what is on her mind. After another disastrous New Years Eve, Bridget makes a resolution to keep a diary, lose weight, cut down on her smoking and drinking, and above all, find herself the perfect man. Her mother tries to assist her in her search for a man, setting her up with Mark Darcy (Colin Firth, in a role comparable to his performance as Mr. Darcy in ‘Pride and Prejudice’), the son of an old family friend. Unfortunately, the first man to notice the new Bridget is her boss, Daniel Cleaver (Hugh Grant), a chauvinistic womaniser with whom she starts a love affair, despite her attraction to Mark. Bridget’s confusion over her attraction to Mark, her relationship with Daniel, is complicated by her meddling and slightly eccentric friends, and the breakdown of her parent’s relationship. Based on the novel by Helen Fielding. Cast also includes Gemma Jones, Celia Imrie, Hugh Grant and Jim Broadbent.

results.title: Bridges in Holland
results.creator_credit: Bert Haanstra, Bert Haanstra Film Productions and Rolf Orthel
results.brief_description: A tribute to Holland’s bridge builders; a beautifully photographed study of the texture and structure of bridges to present a view of Holland in all seasons in all parts. The assembly of shots of bridges from opening ceremonies to demolition tell their own story without commentary. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bridges
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and David Hughes
results.brief_description: A simply stated stimulus film on bridges. Shows children making bridges, asking questions and talking about bridges. Shots of historic bridges and bridges of Melbourne are interspersed throughout. Suitable for primary years prep-6.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and David Hughes
